terms.definition: Specialized professionals in pharmaceutical manufacturing who ensure that equipment, processes, and systems meet strict regulatory standards and function as intended for drug production.
The systematic process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining documents in a centralized system to ensure accuracy, accessibility, and version control.
A software system that captures, organizes, and shares institutional knowledge and information across teams and departments.
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to see revision history and collaborate without conflicts.
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document or project simultaneously, with changes visible instantly to all participants.
Food and Drug Administration - the U.S. federal agency responsible for regulating and supervising the safety of drugs, medical devices, and other consumer products.
Good Manufacturing Practices - a set of regulations and guidelines that ensure pharmaceutical products are consistently produced and controlled according to quality standards.
Quality Management System - a formalized system that documents processes, procedures, and responsibilities for achieving quality policies and objectives.
Enterprise Resource Planning - integrated software that manages and automates core business processes across departments like finance, manufacturing, and supply chain.
A single, unified system where all related data, documents, and processes are stored and managed from one location rather than scattered across multiple systems.
The use of software to automatically execute repetitive tasks and processes according to predefined rules, reducing manual effort and errors.
The state of having all documentation, processes, and systems properly organized and accessible for regulatory inspection or compliance review.
A software design that can efficiently handle increased workload, users, or data volume without requiring major structural changes.
The process of connecting different software systems or platforms so they can share data and work together seamlessly.
The process of accessing and extracting specific information from a database or document management system using search queries or filters.
